Class LevelParent

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
Levels.LevelParent
Direct Known Subclasses:
LevelOne, LevelThree, LevelTwo
public abstract class LevelParent extends Observable
Abstract base class for all game levels. Serves as the parent class for specific levels, providing common functionality such as initializing friendly and enemy units, handling game-over conditions, and transitioning between levels. Extends Observable to support observer-based notifications for game state changes.

  • Field Details

    • isLevelSwitching

      protected boolean isLevelSwitching
      Indicates whether the level is currently switching to another level. Prevents multiple level transitions from being triggered simultaneously.

    • SCREEN_HEIGHT_ADJUSTMENT

      private static final double SCREEN_HEIGHT_ADJUSTMENT
      Adjustment value used to calculate the maximum Y-coordinate for enemy movement. Ensures enemies stay within the visible screen area.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MILLISECOND_DELAY

      private static final int MILLISECOND_DELAY
      Delay in milliseconds for each frame in the game loop. Determines the update frequency of the game logic and rendering.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • screenHeight

      private final double screenHeight
      The height of the game screen. Used for positioning and movement calculations.

    • screenWidth

      private final double screenWidth
      The width of the game screen. Used for positioning and movement calculations.

    • enemyMaximumYPosition

      private final double enemyMaximumYPosition
      The maximum Y-coordinate that enemies can move to. Calculated based on the screen height and a fixed adjustment value.

    • root

      public final javafx.scene.Group root
      The root container for all graphical elements in the level. Serves as the base group for JavaFX scene graph nodes.

    • timeline

      private final javafx.animation.Timeline timeline
      The timeline responsible for running the game loop. Manages the periodic execution of game logic and rendering updates.

    • user

      private final UserPlane user
      The player's plane object. Represents the player's character in the game.

    • scene

      private final javafx.scene.Scene scene
      The JavaFX Scene object representing the level. Contains all visual elements and handles user input.

    • background

      private final javafx.scene.image.ImageView background
      The background image of the level. Provides the visual backdrop for the game environment.

    • friendlyUnits

      private final List<ActiveActorDestructible> friendlyUnits
      A list of all friendly units in the level, including the player's plane. Used for managing interactions and collisions.

    • enemyUnits

      public final List<ActiveActorDestructible> enemyUnits
      A list of all enemy units currently present in the level. Used for managing interactions, collisions, and rendering.

    • userProjectiles

      private final List<ActiveActorDestructible> userProjectiles
      A list of all projectiles fired by the player. Used for managing projectile interactions and collisions.

    • enemyProjectiles

      private final List<ActiveActorDestructible> enemyProjectiles
      A list of all projectiles fired by enemies. Used for managing projectile interactions and collisions.

    • hearts

      private final List<Heart> hearts
      A list of heart items available in the level. Hearts can be collected by the player to restore health.

    • currentNumberOfEnemies

      private int currentNumberOfEnemies
      The current number of enemies in the level. Updated dynamically as enemies are spawned and destroyed.

    • levelView

      private LevelView levelView
      The view component for the level. Manages the display of UI elements such as the player's health bar.

    • isSceneInitialized

      private boolean isSceneInitialized
      Indicates whether the scene has been initialized. Ensures that initialization logic is only executed once.

    • isBackgroundInitialized

      private boolean isBackgroundInitialized
      Indicates whether the background has been initialized. Ensures that background setup is only performed once.

    • isPaused

      protected boolean isPaused
      Indicates whether the game is currently paused. Used to toggle game logic and display the pause menu.

    • pauseMenu

      protected javafx.scene.layout.VBox pauseMenu
      The pause menu displayed when the game is paused. Provides options to resume or quit the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelParent

      public LevelParent(String backgroundImageName, double screenHeight, double screenWidth, int playerInitialHealth)
      Constructs a new instance of LevelParent with the specified parameters. This constructor initializes the game level with a background image, screen dimensions, initial player health, and various game components such as friendly units, enemy units, projectiles, and a timeline for the game loop.
      Parameters:
      backgroundImageName - the file path to the background image.
      screenHeight - the height of the game screen.
      screenWidth - the width of the game screen.
      playerInitialHealth - the initial health of the player's plane.

  • Method Details

    • initializeFriendlyUnits

      protected abstract void initializeFriendlyUnits()
      Initializes the friendly units for the level. This method is responsible for adding the player's plane and other allied entities to the game scene. It must be implemented by subclasses to define level-specific initialization logic.

    • checkIfGameOver

      protected abstract void checkIfGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over in the current level. This method determines whether the player has lost or won the level and triggers appropriate actions. It must be implemented by subclasses to handle level-specific game-over conditions.

    • spawnEnemyUnits

      protected abstract void spawnEnemyUnits()
      Spawns enemy units in the level. This method manages the addition of enemy planes or other adversarial entities to the game scene. Subclasses must implement this method to define level-specific enemy spawning behavior.

    • instantiateLevelView

      protected abstract LevelView instantiateLevelView()
      Instantiates the level view for the current level. The level view handles the UI elements, such as health bars and progress indicators, for the level. Subclasses must implement this method to create and return a level-specific view instance.
      Returns:
      the LevelView instance for the current level.

    • initializeScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene initializeScene()
      Initializes the game scene with necessary components and event listeners.

      This method ensures that the background, friendly units, and visual elements like the heart display are initialized. It also adds a key press listener to handle user input for pausing the game. If the scene is already initialized, it avoids reinitializing the components.

      Returns:
      the initialized Scene object for the game level.

    • initializePauseMenu

      private void initializePauseMenu()
      Initializes the pause menu UI and adds it to the game root.

      The pause menu consists of a styled VBox containing a text label ("Game Paused"), a resume button to resume the game, and a quit button to exit the application. The menu is hidden by default and can be displayed when the game is paused.

    • togglePause

      protected void togglePause()
      Toggles the game's pause state.

      When the game is paused, the timeline is stopped, and the pause menu is displayed. Resuming the game hides the pause menu and restarts the timeline. This method ensures the pause and resume actions are reflected visually and logically.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game by focusing on the background and playing the game timeline.

      If the game timeline is not already running, this method sets the focus on the background element and starts the timeline animation, which drives the game loop.

    • goToNextLevel

      public void goToNextLevel(String levelName)
      Transitions to the specified next game level.

      This method handles the level-switching logic, ensuring that the current level is cleaned up before moving to the next one. It prevents duplicate calls by using a flag and uses a Timeline for delayed execution of the level transition. Observers are notified of the next level's name to facilitate the transition.

      Parameters:
      levelName - the fully qualified class name of the next level to load.

    • cleanUpLevel

      public void cleanUpLevel()
      Cleans up resources and resets the current level state.

      This method clears all actors, projectiles, and other game objects from the scene graph and associated lists. It ensures that the current level's resources are fully released before transitioning to a new level.

    • updateScene

      private void updateScene()
      Updates the game scene during each frame of the timeline.

      This method handles various aspects of the game loop, including:

      • Removing destroyed actors
      • Spawning enemy units and power-ups
      • Updating actor positions
      • Handling collisions and interactions
      • Updating kill counts and the level view
      • Checking for game-over conditions

    • initializeTimeline

      private void initializeTimeline()
      Initializes the game timeline for managing the game loop.

      This method creates a Timeline with an indefinite cycle count and associates a KeyFrame that updates the game scene at regular intervals defined by the MILLISECOND_DELAY.

    • initializeBackground

      private void initializeBackground()
      Initializes the game background and sets up input listeners.

      This method ensures that the background is correctly displayed and interactive. It assigns keyboard input listeners for controlling the user's plane and firing projectiles. If the background has already been initialized, this method logs a message and skips reinitialization.

    • fireProjectile

      private void fireProjectile()
      Fires a projectile from the user's plane.

      This method invokes the user's `fireProjectile` method to create a new projectile. If a projectile is successfully created, it is added to the scene and the list of active user projectiles.

    • spawnHearts

      private void spawnHearts()
      Spawns heart items randomly on the screen.

      This method generates heart items with a specified probability. Hearts are added to the scene and move from right to left while oscillating vertically. When the movement animation completes, the heart is removed from the scene and the list of hearts.

    • handleHeartCollisions

      private void handleHeartCollisions()
      Handles collisions between the user's plane and hearts.

      This method detects collisions between the user's plane and heart items. When a collision is detected, the user's health is incremented, the level view is updated to reflect the new health, and the heart is removed from the scene and the list of hearts.

    • generateEnemyFire

      private void generateEnemyFire()
      Generates projectiles fired by enemy units.

      This method iterates through all enemy units and calls their respective `fireProjectile` methods to create projectiles. The projectiles are added to the scene and the list of active enemy projectiles.

      Specific behaviors are implemented for MutationBoss1 and Boss, while other FighterPlane enemies follow a default firing behavior.

    • updateActors

      private void updateActors()
      Updates the state of all active actors in the scene.

      This method updates the positions and logic for all friendly units, enemy units, user projectiles, and enemy projectiles. It also removes enemy projectiles that exit the screen.

    • removeAllDestroyedActors

      private void removeAllDestroyedActors()
      Removes all destroyed actors from the scene and their respective lists.

      This method iterates through all categories of actors (friendly units, enemy units, user projectiles, and enemy projectiles) and removes any that are marked as destroyed.

    • removeDestroyedActors

      private void removeDestroyedActors(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors)
      Removes destroyed actors from a specified list and the scene.

      This helper method filters out destroyed actors from the provided list, removes them from the scene graph, and updates the list to exclude the destroyed actors.

      Parameters:
      actors - the list of actors to check for destruction and remove.

    • handlePlaneCollisions

      private void handlePlaneCollisions()
      Handles collisions between friendly units and enemy units.

      This method detects and processes collisions between all friendly units (e.g., the player's plane) and enemy units. Upon collision, the involved actors take damage and are destroyed if their health reaches zero.

    • handleUserProjectileCollisions

      private void handleUserProjectileCollisions()
      Handles collisions between user projectiles and enemy units.

      This method checks for intersections between the hitboxes of user-fired projectiles and enemy units. When a collision is detected, both the projectile and the enemy take damage, and are destroyed if their health reaches zero.

    • handleEnemyProjectileCollisions

      private void handleEnemyProjectileCollisions()
      Handles collisions between enemy projectiles and friendly units.

      This method detects intersections between the hitboxes of enemy-fired projectiles and friendly units. Upon collision, the involved actors take damage and are destroyed if their health drops to zero.

    • handleCollisions

      private void handleCollisions(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors1, List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors2)
      Generalized collision handling between two groups of actors.

      This method iterates through two lists of actors and checks for intersections between their hitboxes. If a collision is detected, both actors take damage, and are marked as destroyed if their health reaches zero.

      Parameters:
      actors1 - the first list of actors to check for collisions.
      actors2 - the second list of actors to check for collisions.

    • handleEnemyPenetration

      private void handleEnemyPenetration()
      Handles cases where enemies or projectiles penetrate defensive boundaries.

      This method checks if enemy units or projectiles have exceeded the defensive boundaries (e.g., moved off-screen or into restricted areas). Upon detection, the relevant enemy or projectile is marked as destroyed, and the user may take damage in case of enemy penetration.

    • actorHasPenetratedDefenses

      private boolean actorHasPenetratedDefenses(ActiveActorDestructible actor)
      Determines if an actor has penetrated defensive boundaries.

      This method checks if the actor's position exceeds predefined screen boundaries, indicating that it has penetrated defenses.

      Parameters:
      actor - the actor to check for boundary penetration.
      Returns:
      true if the actor has penetrated defenses, false otherwise.

    • updateLevelView

      private void updateLevelView()
      Updates the level view to reflect changes in the user's state.

      This method synchronizes the visual elements of the level view, such as hearts or health indicators, based on the user's current health.

    • updateKillCount

      private void updateKillCount()
      Updates the kill count based on destroyed enemies.

      This method identifies enemies that have been destroyed, increments the user's kill count for each, and removes the destroyed enemies from the scene and enemy list.

    • enemyHasPenetratedDefenses

      private boolean enemyHasPenetratedDefenses(ActiveActorDestructible enemy)
      Checks if an enemy has exceeded the screen width, indicating a penetration.

      This method evaluates whether an enemy has moved off-screen horizontally, signaling that it has bypassed defenses.

      Parameters:
      enemy - the enemy to check.
      Returns:
      true if the enemy has penetrated defenses, false otherwise.

    • winGame

      protected void winGame()
      Triggers the win game sequence.

      This method stops the game timeline and displays a win image to indicate that the user has won the game.

    • loseGame

      protected void loseGame()
      Triggers the lose game sequence.

      This method stops the game timeline and displays a game-over image to indicate that the user has lost the game.

    • getUser

      protected UserPlane getUser()
      Retrieves the user's plane.
      Returns:
      the UserPlane representing the player's plane.

    • getRoot

      protected javafx.scene.Group getRoot()
      Retrieves the root node of the scene graph.
      Returns:
      the Group root node of the game scene.

    • getCurrentNumberOfEnemies

      protected int getCurrentNumberOfEnemies()
      Retrieves the current number of enemy units in the game.
      Returns:
      the count of enemy units.

    • addEnemyUnit

      protected void addEnemyUnit(ActiveActorDestructible enemy)
      Adds an enemy unit to the game scene and enemy list.

      This method ensures that the enemy is added to the scene graph and the list of active enemy units. If the enemy is a boss, it also ensures the boss's shield image and health bar are added to the scene.

      Parameters:
      enemy - the enemy unit to add.

    • getEnemyMaximumYPosition

      protected double getEnemyMaximumYPosition()
      Retrieves the maximum Y position allowed for enemy units.
      Returns:
      the maximum Y position for enemy units.

    • getScreenWidth

      protected double getScreenWidth()
      Retrieves the width of the game screen.
      Returns:
      the width of the screen.

    • userIsDestroyed

      protected boolean userIsDestroyed()
      Checks if the user's plane is destroyed.
      Returns:
      true if the user's plane is destroyed, false otherwise.

    • updateNumberOfEnemies

      private void updateNumberOfEnemies()
      Updates the current count of active enemy units.

      This method synchronizes the count of active enemy units with the size of the enemy list.
